You can definitely use chicken in this teriyaki recipe, and it's a popular protein choice in Japanese cuisine. Since you've already experimented with chicken in your green curry, you'll find that it works beautifully in teriyaki as well.

**Cooking chicken in teriyaki sauce:**

When using chicken in this recipe, keep the following in mind:

1. **Boneless, skinless chicken breasts or thighs**: You can use either breast or thigh meat, but breasts will cook faster and might become dry if overcooked. Thighs will remain juicier, but might take a bit longer to cook.
2. **Cut into bite-sized pieces**: Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces or strips to ensure even cooking and to prevent undercooked or overcooked areas.
3. **Adjust cooking time**: Chicken will cook faster than beef or pork, so adjust the grilling or pan-frying time accordingly. Typically, chicken will take 5-7 minutes to cook through, depending on the thickness of the pieces.
4. **Grill or pan-fry**: You can grill or pan-fry the chicken, but grilling will give you those nice char marks and a slightly caramelized exterior. Pan-frying will result in a crispy exterior and a juicy interior.
5. **Don't overcook**: Chicken can become dry quickly, so make sure to check its internal temperature (165°F / 74°C) and adjust the cooking time accordingly.

**Tips for cooking chicken in teriyaki sauce:**

1. **Marinate the chicken**: Marinate the chicken in the teriyaki sauce for at least 30 minutes to an hour to help the flavors penetrate the meat.
2. **Use a medium-high heat**: Grill or pan-fry the chicken over medium-high heat to achieve a nice sear and caramelization.
3. **Glaze with teriyaki sauce**: During the last 2-3 minutes of cooking, brush the chicken with the teriyaki sauce to create a sticky, sweet, and savory glaze.
4. **Let it rest**: Once cooked, let the chicken rest for a few minutes before serving to allow the juices to redistribute.

By following these tips, you'll end up with deliciously flavored and cooked chicken in your teriyaki dish. Enjoy!
